title: Fix inefficiency in RichProgressbar
bullets:
Discovered inefficiency in high-frequency metric rendering function,
inside Pytorch Lightning's RichProgressBar

Replaced in-loop string concatenations with a generator expression,
improving runtime efficiency by 10%
benchmarked and visualized performance gains using <external-link href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/timeit.html">timeit </external-link>

title: Introduce configurable metric formatting in RichProgressBar
bullets:
Introduced configurable formatting display for metric values
in Pytorch Lightning's RichProgressBar,
enabling precise tracking of extreme loss values during training

title: Improve default metric formatting for RichProgressbar
bullets:
Introduced a consistent decimal precision for all metric values,
improving stability and readability for all machine learning metrics displayed
Implemented unit tests for verifying configurable formatting

title: Introduce configurable delimiter in RichProgressbar
bullets:
Introduced configurable delimiter for machine learning metrics
in PyTorch Lightning's Rich Progress Bar,
enhancing flexibility and readability of the display

title: Add new variable for external cursor mode
bullets:
Introduced configurable external cursor shape,
enabling users to specify cursor shape during script executions

title: Add mouse scroll support
bullets: Enabled mapping mouse scrolling to custom actions when modifier key is active

title: Support cycling through windows
bullets: Added functionality to cycle through open windows when application is raised repeatedly

title: Support multiple users
bullets: Added functionality to make the program work when multiple users are logged in
